answer.answer:
To update your company's registered name in the app, you'll need to change it at Companies House first üôÇ

Once it's changed on the Companies House website, we'll be notified and will automatically update your company's registered name. We'll let you know via the app when this is done, too.

relatedArticles.question: Changing access rights on Monzo Business

answer.answer:
Right now, anyone you add to your business account will have full access.

This means they can do anything you can do, like make payments, add other people to the account, and withdraw money.

We're working to add different access levels in the future üíÅ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

relatedArticles.question: Switching between Business Lite and Business Pro

answer.answer:
You can switch between Business Lite and Business Pro at any time. Just get in touch through the app and we'll give you a hand.

You can compare the features of each account tier using our [comparison table](https://monzo.com/i/business/features).

Remember: if you have more than one admin on your account and you want to downgrade to Business Lite, you'll have to remove the other admins first. You'll also lose access to your Pro features as soon as you downgrade.

relatedArticles.question: Paying in a cheque to your Monzo Business account

answer.answer:
You can pay cheques into your Monzo Business account by posting them to us for free using Freepost. For higher-value cheques, you might feel more comfortable using tracked postage instead ‚Äì but you don't have to üëç

__Cheque guidelines for sole traders and limited companies__

If you're a sole trader and want to pay in a cheque, it needs be made out to your legal name.

If you own a limited company and want to pay in a cheque, it needs to be made out to your company's registered name.

__Using Freepost üìÆ__

1. Write your 8 digit account number on the back of the cheque in the top left corner. (To find your account number, open the Monzo app, tap the __Home__ icon in the menu bar, then tap the __Account__ button under your Monzo card. If you can't find this button, swipe down on your list of payments.)
2. Make sure the name on your cheque matches the name on your account. (To check this, open the Monzo app, tap your profile picture in the top left of the screen, tap the settings cog icon in the top right of the screen, then tap your name.)
3. Take a photo of the front and back of your cheque, as a copy.
4. Write __FREEPOST MONZO__ (nothing else!) on the envelope and post it to us. You don't need to use a stamp.
5. It'll take 2 to 3 weeks to see the money in your account. That's 7-10 days to reach us, then 4 working days to process. We'll send you an app notification when we start processing your cheque.

__Using tracked postage üè§__

1. Follow steps 1 to 3 above üëÜ
2. Post your cheque to: Monzo, 6th Floor, 38 Finsbury Square, London, EC2A 1PX.
3. We'll send you an app notification when we start processing your cheque. It‚Äôll take 4 working days from that point.

To update your company's registered name in the app, you'll need to change it at [Companies House](https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/companies-house) first üôÇ

Once it's changed on the Companies House website, we'll be notified and will automatically update your company's registered name. We'll let you know via the app when this is done, too.

To update your company's registered address in the app, you'll need to change it at [Companies House](https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/companies-house) first üôÇ

Once it's changed on the Companies House website, we'll be notified and will automatically update your company's registered address. We'll let you know via the app when this is done, too.
